title: COVID-19, Brexit, LNG supply – EDF’s James Chaplin explains what’s affecting the UK Power Market this winter
lead: As we entered this winter there were many uncertainties ahead, even more so than normal with weather, LNG supply, Brexit and COVID-19 at the forefront of the market. These uncertainties have certainly not disappointed with high volatility seen over the past few months.

title: West Berkshire Council plans £10m solar power project
lead: The solar farm would see the installation of more than 45,000 panels, generating enough electricity to power around 4,400 homes every year

title: bp sells 20% stake in Omani gas project for $2.6bn
lead: The move is part of a $25 billion divestment programme by 2025

title: Louise Kingham leaves Energy Institute for bp
lead: The EI’s Chief Executive Officer is expected to support the giant’s transformation into an integrated energy company

title: Ofwat CEO Rachel Fletcher joins Octopus Energy
lead: As Director of Regulation and Economics, Mrs Fletcher will work for the energy system decarbonisation

title: Veolia starts carbon capture trials in energy recovery facilities
lead: The technology will extract CO2 from industrial gases and liquefy it for use in other products

title: Green Investment Group launches new solar energy company
lead: Cero Generation aims to deliver utility-scale, on-site generation projects and integrated energy storage solutions

title: Britain’s smart meter network hits 10 million milestone
lead: The roll out is estimated to prevent the release of up to 275,000 tonnes of CO2 emissions every year

title: Almost 62% of energy consumers are ‘more likely to buy sustainable products’
lead: A third of energy consumers had stopped using a product or service because it was not sustainable, according to a new report

title: Government powers up EV charging network with £20m investment
lead: Funding could double the number of government-funded on-street charge points to nearly 8,000
